"}},"constructor":{"params":{"_authorizedAddresses":"Array of addresses of authorized oracle/relayer addresses: [authorizedOracle, authorizedOracleController, authorizedRelayer]","_jobIds":"Array of For other chains, it will be those chains' standard serializations in bytes."}},"extractIdentityFromPayload(bytes)":{"details":"The _account parameter MUST be the first input argument of the receiving function on the remote chain (address (20-bit) datatype)","params":{"_payload":"The encoded (e.g. ABI encoded for EVM chains) function payload"},"returns":{"_0":"Extracted address"}},"extractValueFromPayload(bytes)":{"details":"The _value parameter MUST be the second input argument of the receiving function on the remote chain (uint256 data type)","params":{"_payload":"The encoded (e.g. ABI encoded for EVM chains) function payload"},"returns":{"_0":"Extracted address"}},"notifyOracleCallback(uint256)":{"params":{"_blockNumber":"The number of the block that was recorded by the Oracle in the notifyOracle() call"}},"owner()":{"details":"Returns the address of the current owner."},"paused()":{"details":"Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise."},"receiveOracleNotification(uint256,bytes32)":{"details":"Can only be called by Oracle","params":{"_blockHeaderHash":"A string of the block header hash from the sending chain","_blockNumber":"A number representing the block of interest from the sending chain"}},"renounceOwnership()":{"details":"Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner."},"sendTransactionPacketToRelayerCallback(bytes)":{"params":{"_transactionId":"Universal transaction ID (e.g. transaction hash) of the tx info that was successfully sent to the Relayer"}},"sendXChainTransaction(bytes,bytes,bytes)":{"params":{"_destinationContract":"Address of the destination contract to call (in bytes to keep generic)","_payload":"Payload in ABI encoded bytes (or equivalent depending on chain)","_recoveryPayload":"Same as above, except it is meant to be recovery instructions on this chain in the event of a failure on the remote chain (optional)"}},"setAuthorizedOracle(address)":{"params":{"_authorizedOracle":"The new address to authorize as the oracle"}},"setAuthorizedOracleController(address)":{"params":{"_authorizedOracleController":"The new address to authorize as the oracle"}},"setAuthorizedRelayer(address)":{"params":{"_authorizedRelayer":"The new address to authorize as the oracle"}},"setCheckFailureJobId(bytes32)":{"params":{"_checkFailureJobId":"Job ID for the relayer"}},"setNotifyOracleJobId(bytes32)":{"params":{"_notifyOracleJobId":"Job ID for notifying the oracle"}},"setOracleContract(address)":{"params":{"_oracleContract":"The oracle contract that the Chainlink node owns"}},"setRelayerContract(address)":{"params":{"_relayerContract":"The relayer contract that the Chainlink node owns"}},"setRequestProofJobId(bytes32)":{"params":{"_requestProofJobId":"Job ID for requesting proofs from the relayer"}},"setSendTxToRelayerJobId(bytes32)":{"params":{"_sendTxToRelayerJobId":"Job ID for sending transactions to the relayer"}},"startRecovery(bytes,bytes)":{"details":"To be called only by Relayer","params":{"_blockHashOrigin":"The block header of the block on the origin chain in which the tx failed ","_txHash":"The failed transaction hash on the remote chain"}},"transferOwnership(address)":{"details":"Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner."},"validateFailedTxProofsCallback(bytes[],bytes[],bytes32)":{"params":{"_blockHeaderHash":"The block header hash that was originally requested (will be checked against storage for authenticity)","_proofBlobs":"Array of proof blobs (one per tx)","_recoveryPayloads":"Array of recovery instructions for each transaction"}},"validateTxProofsCallback(bytes[],bytes[],bytes[],bytes32)":{"params":{"_blockHeaderHash":"The block header hash that was originally requested (will be checked against storage for authenticity)","_destinationContracts":"Array of addresses of destination contracts (one per tx)","_payloads":"Array of payloads for each transaction","_proofBlobs":"Array of proof blobs (one per tx)"}}},"title":"XChainEndpoint. The full contract (inherits from all contracts above) that interfaces with all cross-chain interactions","version":1},"userdoc":{"kind":"user","methods":{"callbackRecovery(bool,bytes32)":{"notice":"Continues recovery process after receiving callback from Oracle to prove remote transaction failed"},"constructor":{"notice":"Constructor. Sets permissions"},"encodeUnlockRequest(address,uint256)":{"notice":"Takes a given account and amount and encodes an unlock request in bytes for EVM chains. Can be overriden for other chains"},"extractIdentityFromPayload(bytes)":{"notice":"Takes an encoded bytes payload and extracts out the _account parameter. Can be overriden depending on unique chain requirements"},"extractValueFromPayload(bytes)":{"notice":"Takes an encoded bytes payload (usually intended for deposit/repatriation) and extracts out the _value parameter. Can be overriden depending on unique chain requirements"},"notifyOracleCallback(uint256)":{"notice":"Callback function for notifyOracle. Receives callback from Chainlink node after oracle job is run"},"receiveOracleNotification(uint256,bytes32)":{"notice":"Receives message from the Oracle to begin the cross chain transaction on the receiving chain"},"sendTransactionPacketToRelayerCallback(bytes)":{"notice":"Receives callback from Relayer, acknowledging receipt of transaction info"},"sendXChainTransaction(bytes,bytes,bytes)":{"notice":"Starts off cross chain transaction by accepting contract & payload, and sending to Relay/Oracle layers"},"setAuthorizedOracle(address)":{"notice":"Sets the `authorizedOracle` address to a new address. This is designed to allow only a certain address to make calls"},"setAuthorizedOracleController(address)":{"notice":"Sets the `authorizedOracleController` address to a new address. This is designed to allow only a certain address to make calls"},"setAuthorizedRelayer(address)":{"notice":"Sets the `authorizedRelayer` address to a new address. This is designed to allow only a certain address to make calls"},"setCheckFailureJobId(bytes32)":{"notice":"Sets the job ID for requesting true failure state of a remote transaction"},"setFetchFailedTransactionsJobId(bytes32)":{"notice":"Sets the job ID for requesting all proofs and tx data for a block hash on the origin chain (for failed TXs)"},"setNotifyOracleJobId(bytes32)":{"notice":"Sets the job ID for notifying the oracle of a block with cross chain activity"},"setOracleContract(address)":{"notice":"Sets the oracle contract that Chainlink calls should be made to"},"setOraclePayment(uint256)":{"notice":"Sets the amount of LINK to pay to a Chainlink node"},"setRelayerContract(address)":{"notice":"Sets the relayer contract that Chainlink calls should be made to"},"setRequestProofJobId(bytes32)":{"notice":"Sets the job ID for requesting all proofs and tx data for a block hash"},"setSendTxToRelayerJobId(bytes32)":{"notice":"Sets the job ID for sending cross-chain related transactions to the relayer"},"startRecovery(bytes,bytes)":{"notice":"Starts recovery process on this chain, assuming that the remote chain transaction failed"},"validateFailedTxProofsCallback(bytes[],bytes[],bytes32)":{"notice":"Executes final recovery process after receiving callback from Relayer and proofs are validated"},"validateTxProofsCallback(bytes[],bytes[],bytes[],bytes32)":{"notice":"Receives callback from Relayer in order to validate all cross chain transactions in a given block on the sending documentation.text:
@notice Notifies the Oracle that the current block contains Zorro cross chain transactions
 @dev Meant to be called internally by the Contract layer

@notice Callback function for notifyOracle. Receives callback from Chainlink node after oracle job is run
 @param _blockNumber The number of the block that was recorded by the Oracle in the notifyOracle() call

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (bytes memory[] memory,bytes memory[] memory,bytes32) external
function (struct Chainlink.Request memory,string memory,bytes memory) pure

params._blockHashOrigin: The block header of the block on the origin chain associated with the cross chain transactions
params._transactionDidFail: True if the transaction did indeed fail

params._authorizedAddresses: Array of addresses of authorized oracle/relayer addresses: [authorizedOracle, authorizedOracleController, authorizedRelayer]
params._jobIds: Array of job IDs for oracle/relayer: [notifyOracleJobId, sendTxToRelayerJobId, requestProofJobId, checkFailureJobId, fetchFailedTransactionsJobId]
params._oracleContracts: Array of addresses of contracts oracle/relayer: [oracleContract, relayerContract]
params._oraclePayment: Amount of LINK to pay the node operator
params._owner: Address of intended owner for this contract

params._account: The address of the wallet (cross chain identity) to unlock funds for
params._amountUSDC: The amount in USDC that should be unlocked and burned

returns._0: The ABI econded bytes. For other chains, it will be those chains' standard serializations in bytes.

extractIdentityFromPayload(bytes).details: The _account parameter MUST be the first input argument of the receiving function on the remote chain (address (20-bit) datatype)

params._payload: The encoded (e.g. ABI encoded for EVM chains) function payload

extractValueFromPayload(bytes).details: The _value parameter MUST be the second input argument of the receiving function on the remote chain (uint256 data type)

params._payload: The encoded (e.g. ABI encoded for EVM chains) function payload

params._blockNumber: The number of the block that was recorded by the Oracle in the notifyOracle() call

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

receiveOracleNotification(uint256,bytes3.details: Can only be called by Oracle

params._blockHeaderHash: A string of the block header hash from the sending chain
params._blockNumber: A number representing the block of interest from the sending chain

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

params._transactionId: Universal transaction ID (e.g. transaction hash) of the tx info that was successfully sent to the Relayer

params._destinationContract: Address of the destination contract to call (in bytes to keep generic)
params._payload: Payload in ABI encoded bytes (or equivalent depending on chain)
params._recoveryPayload: Same as above, except it is meant to be recovery instructions on this chain in the event of a failure on the remote chain (optional)

params._authorizedOracle: The new address to authorize as the oracle

params._authorizedOracleController: The new address to authorize as the oracle

params._authorizedRelayer: The new address to authorize as the oracle

params._checkFailureJobId: Job ID for checking failure state of a transaction on the relayer

params._fetchFailedTransactionsJobId: Job ID for checking failure state of a transaction on the relayer

params._notifyOracleJobId: Job ID for notifying the oracle

params._oracleContract: The oracle contract that the Chainlink node owns

params._relayerContract: The relayer contract that the Chainlink node owns

params._requestProofJobId: Job ID for requesting proofs from the relayer

params._sendTxToRelayerJobId: Job ID for sending transactions to the relayer

startRecovery(bytes,bytes).details: To be called only by Relayer

params._blockHashOrigin: The block header of the block on the origin chain in which the tx failed
params._txHash: The failed transaction hash on the remote chain

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

params._blockHeaderHash: The block header hash that was originally requested (will be checked against storage for authenticity)
params._proofBlobs: Array of proof blobs (one per tx)
params._recoveryPayloads: Array of recovery instructions for each transaction

params._blockHeaderHash: The block header hash that was originally requested (will be checked against storage for authenticity)
params._destinationContracts: Array of addresses of destination contracts (one per tx)
params._payloads: Array of payloads for each transaction
params._proofBlobs: Array of proof blobs (one per tx)

devdoc.title: XChainEndpoint. The full contract (inherits from all contracts above) that interfaces with all cross-chain interactions

callbackRecovery(bool,bytes32).notice: Continues recovery process after receiving callback from Oracle to prove remote transaction failed

encodeUnlockRequest(address,uint256).notice: Takes a given account and amount and encodes an unlock request in bytes for EVM chains. Can be overriden for other chains

extractIdentityFromPayload(bytes).notice: Takes an encoded bytes payload and extracts out the _account parameter. Can be overriden depending on unique chain requirements

extractValueFromPayload(bytes).notice: Takes an encoded bytes payload (usually intended for deposit/repatriation) and extracts out the _value parameter. Can be overriden depending on unique chain requirements

notifyOracleCallback(uint256).notice: Callback function for notifyOracle. Receives callback from Chainlink node after oracle job is run

receiveOracleNotification(uint256,bytes3.notice: Receives message from the Oracle to begin the cross chain transaction on the receiving chain

sendTransactionPacketToRelayerCallback(b.notice: Receives callback from Relayer, acknowledging receipt of transaction info

sendXChainTransaction(bytes,bytes,bytes).notice: Starts off cross chain transaction by accepting contract & payload, and sending to Relay/Oracle layers

setAuthorizedOracle(address).notice: Sets the `authorizedOracle` address to a new address. This is designed to allow only a certain address to make calls

setAuthorizedOracleController(address).notice: Sets the `authorizedOracleController` address to a new address. This is designed to allow only a certain address to make calls

setAuthorizedRelayer(address).notice: Sets the `authorizedRelayer` address to a new address. This is designed to allow only a certain address to make calls

setCheckFailureJobId(bytes32).notice: Sets the job ID for requesting true failure state of a remote transaction

setFetchFailedTransactionsJobId(bytes32).notice: Sets the job ID for requesting all proofs and tx data for a block hash on the origin chain (for failed TXs)

setNotifyOracleJobId(bytes32).notice: Sets the job ID for notifying the oracle of a block with cross chain activity

setOracleContract(address).notice: Sets the oracle contract that Chainlink calls should be made to

setOraclePayment(uint256).notice: Sets the amount of LINK to pay to a Chainlink node

setRelayerContract(address).notice: Sets the relayer contract that Chainlink calls should be made to

setRequestProofJobId(bytes32).notice: Sets the job ID for requesting all proofs and tx data for a block hash

setSendTxToRelayerJobId(bytes32).notice: Sets the job ID for sending cross-chain related transactions to the relayer

startRecovery(bytes,bytes).notice: Starts recovery process on this chain, assuming that the remote chain transaction failed

validateFailedTxProofsCallback(bytes[],b.notice: Executes final recovery process after receiving callback from Relayer and proofs are validated

validateTxProofsCallback(bytes[],bytes[].notice: Receives callback from Relayer in order to validate all cross chain transactions in a given block on the sending chain
